page.title: 02Houses in the area
page.content: In the village of Llanlleoch, to the north of our area, some of the houses near the church are old buildings, those in Mill Row and Boxburgh Hall. Others in the estate are modern, built in the last 20 years.Here the dwellings are entirely bungalows and have all modern conveniences. The older houses have all been modernized and have had main sewerage exteded to them in 1985. The farmhouses in the area are older but have been brought up to modern standards and now much favoured as dwellings. The newer houses have tiled roofs while the older ones have roofs of Caernarvon slate.
